abstract: While taking pictures for its Street View project, Google also recorded Internet traffic from open Wi-Fi networks in homes and businesses.
snippet: While taking pictures for its Street View project, Google also recorded Internet traffic from open Wi-Fi networks in homes and businesses.
lead_paragraph: While taking pictures for its Street View project, Google also recorded Internet traffic from open Wi-Fi networks in homes and businesses.

headline.main: How Google Collected Data From Wi-Fi Networks

abstract: All sorts of private Internet communications were casually scooped up as Google Street View cars photographed the world’s streets.
snippet: All sorts of private Internet communications were casually scooped up as Google Street View cars photographed the world’s streets.
lead_paragraph: Secrets spilled across the computer screen.

headline.main: Google Privacy Inquiries Get Little Cooperation

byline.original: By David Streitfeld and Kevin J. O'Brien

abstract: Also, “American Idol” approaches an off-season of “creative reinvigoration” to counter falling ratings, and the Metropolitan Opera reconsiders.
snippet: Also, “American Idol” approaches an off-season of “creative reinvigoration” to counter falling ratings, and the Metropolitan Opera reconsiders.
lead_paragraph: “American Idol” on Wednesday night will crown a new winner — its 11th — marking the end of a season that has added a little tarnish to the jewel of network television. The program’s still-huge viewer totals are down nearly 25 percent — dipping below 20 million a night. The decline can be attributed to greater competition, Fox executives say, including a rival singing competition, “The Voice” on NBC, that they once dismissed. All of which is clearing the way for some “creative reinvigoration” at the show, said Kevin Reilly, the president of entertainment for Fox.

headline.main: The Breakfast Meeting: Google Gets Defensive, and Remote Control Inventor Dies

abstract: WPP, one of the world’s largest advertising companies, has entered into a partnership with Microsoft that will allow both of the companies to place and sell digital ads for the brands and publishers they work with.
snippet: WPP, one of the world’s largest advertising companies, has entered into a partnership with Microsoft that will allow both of the companies to place and sell digital ads for the brands and publishers they work with.
lead_paragraph: WPP, one of the world’s largest advertising concerns, has entered into a partnership with Microsoft that will allow both companies to place and sell digital ads for the brands and publishers they work with, the companies said Wednesday. Financial terms were not disclosed.

headline.main: WPP in Microsoft Deal for Digital Ads

abstract: After a meeting with Google executives on Wednesday, the regulator said the company’s answers to a questionnaire about the new policy had not addressed many of its concerns.
snippet: After a meeting with Google executives on Wednesday, the regulator said the company’s answers to a questionnaire about the new policy had not addressed many of its concerns.
lead_paragraph: PARIS — Already facing scrutiny from antitrust authorities and privacy regulators on a variety of fronts, Google was criticized Wednesday by French data protection authorities, who accused the company of being insufficiently forthcoming in an investigation of its new privacy policy.

headline.print_headline: French Agency Faults Google for Reply on Policy

abstract: Microsoft and Google are jostling for bigger shares of the search market by including more data on search subjects.
snippet: Microsoft and Google are jostling for bigger shares of the search market by including more data on search subjects.
lead_paragraph: You whippersnappers might not remember, but libraries used to have something called card catalogs. Each book’s index card told you which shelf housed the corresponding volume. You had to go fetch it on foot.
